titles.title: Tokyo Ghoul:Re
東京喰種[トーキョーグール]:re
Tokyo Ghoul:Re
Токийский гуль:re
도쿄 구울: RE
东京喰种:re

recommendations.recommendation: Takes place where the prequel left off, however kaneki ken was pretty much non existent, a lot of new characters, hopefully next season would be better

anime.description: Years have passed since the violent destruction of http://anidb.net/ch70053 [Anteiku]. The http://anidb.net/ch69612 [Commission of Counter Ghoul] is the only organization fighting the http://anidb.net/t7110 [Ghoul] menace, and in order to get the upper hand on their targets, the CCG has instituted a new program where operatives are implanted with kakuho, the Ghoul organ of predation. This http://anidb.net/t7111 [Quinx] procedure has successfully created four young Qs who are being mentored by their predecessor, http://anidb.net/ch92821 [Sasaki Haise]. And while Haise might be the first Quinx, his origins are somewhat mysterious, especially to him. While he knows with certainty that he is Sasaki Haise now, he can`t remember the first two decades of his life and strange voices seem to echo in his mind. To stave off his own inner turmoil, Haise is focused on the difficult task of training his untested charges and meeting the squad goal of surpassing the premier CCG operative, Investigator http://anidb.net/ch98685 [Arima]. And the Quinx Squad not only have to learn to control their Ghoul-like powers, they also have a hell of a lot to prove to the CCG. Many other squads look at the Qs with suspicion or disdain, but Haise and the other Qs are determined to live up to the high expectations placed on them. But while the Qs struggle to figure themselves out and fit in, the Ghouls of http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree] are increasing their membership and expanding their influence. Every step the CCG takes towards total Ghoul eradication seems to be blocked by smarter, stronger, better-organized Ghouls. And as the war to save humankind heats up, familiar faces from battles past begin to show up. Source: Viz Media

externalentity.identifier: 東京喰種トーキョーグール

tag.name: reverse trap
tag.description: A reverse trap is a plot device where a female character is mistaken for a male, with the intention of sexually deceiving other characters and/or the viewer. This behavior does not need to be intentional by the female (it is often not intentional) or continually maintained by the female, but the occurrence is common enough to deserve this fetish-specific tag. This is often achieved by portraying the female character as a male; primarily via their clothing and physical appearance, but also through her behaviour, and/or language. A female character misinterpreted by others as male, without action from the female (explicitly masculine dress or behaviour), is generally not considered a reverse trap; instead they are likely just http://anidb.net/t2561 [androgynous]. The reverse case is known as a http://anidb.net/t618 [trap].

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: cross-dressing
tag.description: This character sometimes wears clothes traditionally worn by and associated with the opposite sex. Cross-dressers often hide their cross-dressing identity for a long period of time and thus tend to become adept in accurately portraying the opposite sex in terms of voice, movement, behaviour, temperament, etc.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: human enhancement
tag.description: Human enhancement can take various forms: It can be something comparatively non-intrusive as a power-up drug, a form of machine implantation or cyberization (http://anidb.net/a4414 [SAC Solid State Society]), or outright - possibly atrocious - genetic manipulation (http://anidb.net/a361 [Ao no 6 Gou]). Plot-wise enhanced protagonists in anime usually have to pay a price for their enhancements, be it physical or mental.

tag.name: contemporary fantasy
tag.description: Contemporary fantasy, also known as modern fantasy or indigenous fantasy, is a sub-genre of fantasy, set in the present day. It is perhaps most popular for its sub-genre, urban fantasy. These terms are used to describe stories set in the putative real world (often referred to as consensus reality) in contemporary times, in which magic and magical creatures exist, either living in the interstices of our world or leaking over from alternate worlds. It thus has much in common with, and sometimes overlaps with secret history; a work of fantasy in which the magic could not remain secret or does not have any known relationship to known history would not fit into this subgenre. Occasionally certain contemporary fantasy novels will make reference to pop culture. Novels in which modern characters travel into alternate worlds, and all the magical action takes place there (except for the portal required to transport them), are not considered contemporary fantasy. Thus, C.S. Lewis`s The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, where all fantasy events take place in the land of Narnia which is reached via a magic wardrobe, would not count as contemporary fantasy; on the other hand, the part of The Magician`s Nephew, where the Empress Jadis gets to London, tries to take over the Earth and clashes with police and a crowd of cockneys, would qualify as such. Contemporary fantasy is also to be distinguished from horror fiction, which also often has contemporary settings. When encountering magical events and creatures, the protagonist of a horror novel is horrified, while the protagonist of a fantasy novel (contemporary or otherwise) is filled with a sense of joy and wonder. Horrifying events may happen, but the fundamental distinction is vital. In his preface to That Hideous Strength, one of the earlier works falling within this sub-genre, C.S. Lewis explained why, when writing a tale about "magicians, devils, pantomime animals and planetary angels", he chose to start it with a detailed depiction of narrow-minded academic politics at a provincial English university and the schemes of crooked real estate developers: "I am following the traditional fairy-tale. We do not always notice its method, because the cottages, castles, woodcutters and petty kings with which a fairy tale opens have become for us as remote as the witches and ogres to which it proceeds. But they were not remote at all to the men who first made and enjoyed the tales". The same is true for many of the later works in the genre, which often begin with a seemingly normal scene of modern daily life to then disclose supernatural and magical beings and events hidden behind the scenes. Source: wiki

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Tokyo
tag.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government. Tokyo is in the Kantou region on the southeastern side of the main island Honshu and includes the Izu Islands and Ogasawara Islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: horror
tag.description: The horror cinematic genre is characterized by the attempt to make the viewer experience dread, fear, terror, or horror. Often their plots involve the intrusion of an evil force, event or personage, sometimes of supernatural origin, on the mundane world and the consequences thereof.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: mutilation
tag.description: Mutilation is an act of physical injury that degrades the appearance or function of any living body. Some ethnic groups practice ritual mutilation, e.g. scarification, burning, flagellation(whipping), tattooing, or wheeling, as part of a rite of passage. In some cases, the term may apply to treatment of dead bodies, such as soldiers mutilated after they have been killed by an enemy. Maiming, or mutilation which involves the loss of, or incapacity to use, a bodily member, is and has been practised by many societies with various cultural and religious significances, and is also a customary form of physical punishment, especially applied on the principle of "an eye for an eye". Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: everybody dies
tag.description: Not necessarily everyone, but a good portion of the characters kick the bucket.

tag.name: eating of humans
tag.description: The eating of humans, also called man-eating, is the practice of some species to prey on human beings for nourishment. Examples of possible hunters may include Earth animals, alien species, zombies or other undead, and so forth. Eating of humans is not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t3815 [human cannibalism]; the former is about other species eating people, while the latter is about humans eating fellow humans.

tag.name: human experimentation
tag.description: Genetic, biological, chemical or psychological experimentation on human beings are portrayed or their aftermath is shown.

tag.name: gore
tag.description: A Splatter film or Gore film is a sub-genre of horror film that deliberately focuses on graphic portrayals of gore and graphic violence. These films, through the use of special effects and excessive blood and guts, tend to display an overt interest in the vulnerability of the human body and the theatricality of its mutilation. Due to their willingness to portray images society might consider shocking, splatter films share some ideological grounds with the transgressive art movement. The term "splatter cinema" was coined by George A. Romero to describe his film Dawn of the Dead, though Dawn of the Dead is generally considered by critics to have higher aspirations, such as social commentary, than to be simply exploitative for its own sake. [Source: wiki]

tag.name: manipulated memories
tag.description: The protagonist finds out that his/her cherished memories are actually fake and have been implanted.

tag.name: psychological
tag.description: Directed toward dealing with or affecting the mind, especially as a function of awareness, feeling, or motivation.

tag.name: time skip
tag.description: The plot features at least one skip or jump in time. Example: A skip from the present into the past, or time skips in increments, e.g. every hour there is a time skip by a day.

tag.name: fast-paced
tag.description: Hold onto your hats, this anime`s storyline is relentless. The characters don`t get time to take a breath as events keep both them and the viewer on a roller coaster ride of revelation and excitement! Hopefully it all makes sense...

tag.name: guns are useless
tag.description: Guns are about as effective as throwing tissue while only manly things like swords, spears, and bare fists are any use at all. If the weapon shoots a projectile faster than human eyes can track, it is useless. Most guns only serve as a filler for the protagonist to dodge all their shots so they can kill them with a "real" weapon. The sniper rifle is an occasional exception to this rule. This is because it can be used to quickly and efficiently reduce the amount of character development the animators have to worry about.

tag.name: gender bender
tag.description: Term used to refer to a person who takes on the role of their opposite gender. This often only reaches to the extent of cross-dressing (involving physical appearance and clothing only), but in rarer cases, involves a total gender swap (which seems to be more common in anime) - where the willing or unwilling victim receives a body opposite of their original gender (either permanently or temporarily), with all natural parts per their new body fully (or just all-out amply) included. Example of cross-dressing gender bender: "Maria+Holic" Examples of body-swap gender bender: "Kashimashi: Girl meets Girl", "Birdy the Mighty Decode"

tag.name: mystery
tag.description: The mystery film is a sub-genre of the more general category of crime film. It focuses on the efforts of the detective, private investigator or amateur sleuth to solve the mysterious circumstances of a crime by means of clues, investigation, and clever deduction. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: torture
tag.description: Torture involves the deliberate act of inflicting pain, to either fulfill a desire of the torturer, or apply coercion to compel action from the victim. Torture, by definition, is a knowing and intentional act; deeds which unknowingly or negligently inflict pain without a specific intent to do so are not typically considered torture. This is distinct from http://anidb.net/t2905 [erotic torture], which is generally for the purpose of using (almost) any form of physical or excessive psychological abuse to inflict physical and/or mental pain, with the goal of inducing sexual pleasure.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Ghoul Taisaku Kyoku
character.description: The Commission of Counter Ghoul, usually abbreviated as CCG, is a federal agency that serves as a criminal investigative body in cases connected to http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghouls]. The CCG`s headquarters are in the 1st Ward. The ghouls commonly call the http://anidb.net/t7112 [ghoul investigators] Doves, a nickname originating from the CCG`s seal. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Donato Porpora
character.description: Donato Porpora is a powerful Russian http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] captured by http://anidb.net/ch92823 [Urie]`s father and imprisoned by http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG], who once posed as a Catholic priest and raised http://anidb.net/ch66561 [Amon Koutarou]. He is considered a valuable source of information on other ghouls, due to having no loyalty to others. His favorite victims were the orphans he raised. Strangely, he spared Amon after the boy caught him butchering another child. This fact continues to haunt Amon. Once the Cochlea is breached after http://anidb.net/ch92821 [Haise]`s betrayal, he manages to escape and rejoin his fellow Clowns. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Hirako Take
character.description: Hirako Take was a Senior Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] before resigning from the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]. In the past he formed a duo with http://anidb.net/ch70038 [Arima Kishou]. He was in charge of the 21st ward and previously investigated the S-rated ghoul http://anidb.net/ch95690 [Serpent] with http://anidb.net/ch95847 [his squad], but was later transferred to work alongside Arima again. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Kuroiwa Iwao
character.description: Kuroiwa Iwao is a Special Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and an Investigation Commander in Division I. He served as the Vice Commander of the 11th Ward Special Countermeasures Unit, and Vice Commander of Squad 1 during the Owl Suppression Operation. He was seriously wounded during the battle, losing his left hand. Even so, he has managed to continue serving as an investigator and was greatly admired for his charisma. http://anidb.net/ch69927 [Shinohara Yukinori] used to call him by the nickname Iwaccho. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Big Madam
character.description: Big Madam is an influential Ghoul involved in the underground society of Ghoul Restaurants and human trafficking. Though considered a major target, she has eluded numerous extermination attempts and uses http://anidb.net/ch95702 [Nutcracker] to obtain "ingredients" for her organization. She has raised http://anidb.net/ch69837 [Suzuya Juuzou], using him as a Scrapper and her personal plaything. In spite of her large size, Big Madam is a skilled and deadly opponent. Her appearance belies great agility and incredible strength, allowing her to crawl along walls and dodge attacks from swift opponents. She is defeated by Juuzou and killed by the members of his squad during the raid at the Auction. After her death, Big Madam`s birth sex is revealed to be male and she is referred to by Juuzou as "Father". Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Itou Kuramoto
character.description: Itou Kuramoto is a First-Class Investigator, and member of Hirako`s team. He is easy-going and cheerful, slowly becoming a good friend to http://anidb.net/ch92821 [Sasaki] and the Quinx. After the Auction, he finds himself suddenly given command of the squad and has misgivings about it. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Fura Taishi
character.description: Fura Taishi is a First-Class Ghoul Investigator.

character.name: Arima Kishou
character.description: Arima Kishou is a classmate of http://anidb.net/ch76474 [Taishi], http://anidb.net/ch76471 [Aki] and http://anidb.net/ch76473 [Minami]`s, as well as undercover Ghoul Investigator. He was assigned to deal with Lantern in 13th Ward. During the fight with Lantern, Taishi learned about his involvement with Doves and agreed to help him in order to avenge his http://anidb.net/ch76472 [friend]`s death. Later on, Minami joined the team and helped out gathering clues about Ghouls.

character.name: Orochi
character.description: Serpent is a powerful S rank http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] goes around hunting down and killing http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] http://anidb.net/t7112 [investigators] as well as other ghouls. He seems to have a great dislike towards both CCG and http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree] commenting that they are the same and disgusting for creating "fake" ghouls. His kagune is a tail-like formation that wraps around his leg and enhances the strength of his kicks beyond those of his rank. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Saeki Karao
character.description: Saeki Karao, also known as Torso, is a ghoul serial killer who is known for dismembering, then decapitating his victims by only taking their torso, although he only targets females. He was investigated by the CCG`s Mado and Shimoguchi Squads. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kuroiwa Takeomi
character.description: Kuroiwa Takeomi is a Rank 2 Investigator, and member of Team Hirako. He is the son of Special Class http://anidb.net/ch72813 [Kuroiwa Iwao], and considered to be an exceptionally gifted young Investigator. Kuramoto notes that he is among the 0.01% of humans that possesses physical strength above normal human limitations, and can therefore actually fight ghouls unarmed. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kijima Shiki
character.description: Kijima Shiki is an Associate Special Class Investigator heavily covered in scars obtained when he was attacked by the ghoul nicknamed Jail. He is a sadistic former Interrogator, willing to push the boundaries in pursuit of his prey. His Quinque, "Rotten Follow", is a chainsaw powered by a Kakuhou harvested from Jail`s older brother. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kirishima Touka
character.description: After the time skip, Touka is seen running a new coffee shop called http://anidb.net/ch95856 [:Re] with http://anidb.net/ch67129 [Renji]. She also appears to have matured some in that she is calmer and has a less aggressive demeanor than in her teenage years. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kirishima Ayato
character.description: After the time skip, Ayato adopts the identity of Black Rabbit and takes credit for his http://anidb.net/ch95700 [sister]`s crimes. He also becomes http://anidb.net/ch95691 [Hinami]`s partner after she joins the http://anidb.net/ch70052 [organization] and cares deeply for her, to the point of staging an invasion of http://anidb.net/ch95846 [Cochlea] in order to save her from being executed. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Nutcracker
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch95830 [Mayu], in her http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] costume.

character.name: Furuta Nimura
character.description: Furuta Nimura is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He was originally Washuu-Furuta Souta, the illegitimate son of former http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] Chairman http://anidb.net/ch96193 [Washuu Tsuneyoshi] and an agent of http://anidb.net/ch98950 [V] raised in the Sunlit Garden. While working as a Rank 1 Ghoul Investigator, he used the alias of Furuta Nimura. To further his own agenda, he has used various identities to infiltrate organizations or build personal alliances. As a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95833 [Clowns], he goes by the name Souta and was responsible for the Steel Beam Incident. He also joined the Ghoul Restaurant as PG, and has been a partner in http://anidb.net/ch68389 [Kanou Akihiro]`s ghoulification experiments. Like http://anidb.net/ch65636 [Kaneki Ken], he is an artificial one-eyed ghoul who possesses http://anidb.net/ch65638 [Kamishiro Rize]`s kagune. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Suzuya Juuzou
character.description: After the time skip, Suzuya Juuzou rises further in the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s ranks and becomes leader of http://anidb.net/ch95743 [his own squad], having matured more thanks to http://anidb.net/ch69927 [Shinohara] and become a responsible, if eccentric, adult. He is promoted to Special Class at the age of 22, the first to reach the rank that young since http://anidb.net/ch70038 [Arima]. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Suzuya Juuzou
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch95704 [Suzuya Juuzou], as he appeared during operation Auction Sweep.

character.name: Abara Hanbee
character.description: Abara Hanbee is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s http://anidb.net/ch95743 [Suzuya Squad] and is assigned to the 13th Ward. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Washuu Matsuri
character.description: Washuu Matsuri is the son of http://anidb.net/ch72815 [Washuu Yoshitoki], a Special Class Investigator and a commander in Division II. He distinguished himself while serving in Germany, eliminating the Rosewald Family and rapidly climbing the ranks. He opposes the existence of the Quinx, and treats http://anidb.net/ch92821 [Sasaki] with disrespect. He`s also known for his callous attitude, and his teams taking heavy losses to get the maximum results, seeing them as expendable. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Matsumae
character.description: Matsumae is a serious and efficient woman that has served the Tsukiyama family for a long time. She has spent her life watching over her http://anidb.net/ch66562 [young master], as both a nanny and a teacher at his school. Officially, she is the General Manager of the Tsukiyama Group. Matsumae can wrap her kagune around her arms, forming a sword and shield pair and seems to be quite adept at using the shield both offensively and defensively. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Tsukiyama Mirumo
character.description: Tsukiyama Mirumo is a wealthy and highly-eccentric http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul], well-known within ghoul society for his extravagance. He is the father of http://anidb.net/ch66562 [Tsukiyama Shuu], the once-infamous Gourmet. He deeply loved his wife, who died while their son was still very young. He describes their relationship as having been a passionate romance, and still keeps a place at the table for her. His kindness to his servants and subordinates has earned him their undying loyalty. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kusakari Miza
character.description: Kusakari Miza is an Executive member of http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri] and the leader of the Blades, a gang in control of the 18th Ward. She comes from a clan of inbred Bikaku ghouls that hid underground. Their history of incest has resulted in poor health and dwarfism being common. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Ganbo
character.description: Ganbo was a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] and a member of the Clowns. He appeared alongside http://anidb.net/ch74214 [Hoito Roma] as entertainment during the Auction, and was later killed by http://anidb.net/ch95697 [Kuroiwa Takeomi] bare-handed. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Hayashimura Naoto
character.description: Hayashimura Naoto is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and tee former deputy squad leader of the Ooshiba Squad. After the operation Auction Sweep, he got promoted to the rank of a Senior Investigator.

character.name: Ooshiba Ryouta
character.description: Ooshiba Ryouta was a First-Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He participated as the squad leader during the raid at the Auction.

character.name: Akai Tomonori
character.description: Akai Tomonori was a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He participated as a member of the Atou Squad under http://anidb.net/ch95736 [Atou Daisuke] during the raid at the Auction. He got killed by http://anidb.net/ch95731 [Takizawa Seidou] while attempting to hold him back so that his fellow squad members can escape.

character.name: Atou Daisuke
character.description: Atou Daisuke was an Associate Special Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He participated as the squad leader during the raid at the Auction.

character.name: Tougi Hina
character.description: Tougi Hina was a Rank 2 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. She participated as a member of the Atou Squad under http://anidb.net/ch95736 [Atou Daisuke] during the raid at the Auction.

character.name: Black Rabbit
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch95701 [Ayato] as the Black Rabbit.

character.name: Ui Koori
character.description: Ui Koori is a Special Class Investigator, and member of the S3 Squad. He is a protege of http://anidb.net/ch70038 [Arima Kishou], and took part in the battle against the Owl two years ago as the Vice-Commander of Squad Zero. His Quinque`s unique properties allow it to be used as a whip or a spear. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Nakarai Keijin
character.description: Nakarai Keijin is a First Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He is the deputy squad leader of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s http://anidb.net/ch95743 [Suzuya Squad] assigned to the 13th Ward. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Tamaki Mizurou
character.description: Tamaki Mizurou is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s http://anidb.net/ch95743 [Suzuya Squad] and is assigned to the 13th Ward.

character.name: Mikage Miyuki
character.description: Mikage Miyuki is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He is a member of the CCG`s Suzuya Squad and is assigned to the 13th ward. He is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s http://anidb.net/ch95743 [Suzuya Squad] and is assigned to the 13th Ward. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Arima-han
character.description: Arima Squad was the squad originally under the lead of http://anidb.net/ch70038 [Arima Kishou] himself. During the Owl Suppression and Rushima Landing operations, it acted under the name Squad 0. It was tasked with eliminating any ghouls fleeing through the underground tunnels and defeating the Non-Killing Owl in case it penetrated from underground. The squad made its first appearance before the final battle against the One-Eyed Owl during the conclusion of the Owl Suppression operation. The squad would later appear during the Auction Sweep operation as part of the S3 Squad. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Ihei Hairu
character.description: Ihei Hairu is a Senior Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator], alumni of the http://anidb.net/ch99445 [Sunlit Garden], and partner to http://anidb.net/ch95742 [Ui Koori]. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Quinx-han
character.description: The Quinx Squad or Qs Squad is a squad affiliated to http://anidb.net/ch95877 [Mado Squad] that consists entirely of http://anidb.net/t7111 [quinx]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Mayu
character.description: Mayu was a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] who preyed on men by crushing their testicles before drinking the fluids. She was tasked with capturing humans for an underground Gourmet society. With the http://anidb.net/ch95692 [Torso] investigation put on hold, the http://anidb.net/ch95829 [Quinx Squad] was reassigned to assist the http://anidb.net/ch95743 [Suzuya Squad] with her case. During their meeting, her identity had been uncovered. However, because of her involvement in a human trafficking ring and links to a Gourmet society, they decided to simply observe her. They learned that she was seeking targets in the 13th Ward, for an upcoming Auction. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Pierrot
character.description: The Clowns are a group of http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghouls] with a mysterious goal or purpose. Its members primarily wear clown-themed masks. The http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] had planned a famous investigation on them in the 3rd Ward, as mentioned in Ogura Hisashi`s New Book of Ghoul Dismantling read by http://anidb.net/ch67130 [Nagachika Hideyoshi], but their current residing ward is unspecified. There is no data on their member amount, activity area, nor goals in the CCG database. It is stated that the Clowns do not usually group up, but when they do, they demonstrate exceptional teamwork. http://anidb.net/ch74218 [Itou Kuramoto] notes that they are considered ghouls that http://anidb.net/t7112 [ghoul investigators] would rather not encounter. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Cochlea
character.description: Cochlea is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] detention center located in the 23rd Ward owned by the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]. Captured ghouls get detained here after the decision is made to keep them alive either for information, quinque materials, or any other exceptional need from them. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Umeno Masami
character.description: Umeno Masami is a Rank 2 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95847 [Hirako Squad].

character.name: Nezu Yasuhito
character.description: Nezu Yasuhito is a Rank 2 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95847 [Hirako Squad].

character.name: Shiro Suits
character.description: The White Suits is a gang of http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghouls] named for the distinct style of clothing worn by members. They are known for their strong loyalty to one another. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Gagi
character.description: Gagi is one of the ghoul twins who serve as http://anidb.net/ch72224 [Naki]`s henchmen.

character.name: Guge
character.description: Guge is one of the ghoul twins who serve as http://anidb.net/ch72224 [Naki]`s henchmen.

character.name: :Re
character.description: :Re is a coffee shop run by http://anidb.net/ch67129 [Yomo Renji] and http://anidb.net/ch95700 [Kirishima Touka].

character.name: Kobayashi Akashi
character.description: Kobayashi Akashi is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] that resided in the 1st Ward, working as a taxi driver. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Kuroiwa-han
character.description: Kuroiwa-han is a http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] squad under the command of Special Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] http://anidb.net/ch72813 [Kuroiwa Iwao]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Mado-han
character.description: The Mado Squad is a http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] squad under the command of Associate Special Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] http://anidb.net/ch95688 [Mado Akira]. Her squad includes http://anidb.net/ch95829 [Quinx Squad]`s members as well. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: S1-han
character.description: The S1 Squad is a special unit within the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG], handling high priority assignments and dangerous targets. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: S2-han
character.description: The S2 Squad is a special unit within the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG], handling high priority assignments and dangerous targets. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: S3-han
character.description: The S3 Squad is a special unit within the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG], handling high priority assignments and dangerous targets. It is considered an illustrious assignment, with considerable honors involved. One of such assignments was facing high-rated targets such as the One-Eyed Owl. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Amon Koutarou
character.description: Captured by http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri], Amon Koutarou was given to http://anidb.net/ch68389 [Dr. Kanou] who made him into a http://anidb.net/t7113 [artifical one-eyed ghoul].

character.name: Tsukiyama-ke
character.description: The Tsukiyama Family is a family of upper-class http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghouls], with considerable wealth and influence within human society. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Rose
character.description: The Rose is a group of "hunters" of the http://anidb.net/ch95889 [Tsukiyama Family], tasked with "acquiring food".

character.name: Yuuma
character.description: Yuuma is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul], an employee of the http://anidb.net/ch95889 [Tsukiyama Family] and a member of their hunting group, http://anidb.net/ch95890 [Rose].

character.name: Mairo
character.description: Mairo is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul], an employee of the http://anidb.net/ch95889 [Tsukiyama Family] and a member of their hunting group, http://anidb.net/ch95890 [Rose].

character.name: Numa Jun
character.description: Numa Jun was a Rank 2 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and participated in the Operation Auction Sweep as a member of the Tateshima Squad. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Hooguro
character.description: Hooguro is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95853 [White Suits] and subordinate of http://anidb.net/ch72224 [Naki]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Idera Shousei
character.description: Idera Shousei is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95853 [White Suits] and subordinate of http://anidb.net/ch72224 [Naki]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Hakatori
character.description: The Grave Robber, also known as Quinque Hunter, is http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] who has a habit of collecting quinque from the ghoul investigators she kills. She is a member of http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Shikorae
character.description: Shikorae is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] and a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95833 [Clowns].

character.name: Washuu Tsuneyoshi
character.description: Washuu Tsuneyoshi is the current http://anidb.net/ch69612 [Commission of Counter Ghoul]`s chairman.

character.name: Asada Jirou
character.description: Asada Jirou is the owner of Asada Goods and a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95889 [Tsukiyama family]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Tycho Johannes
character.description: Tycho Johannes is the owner of Jewelry Tycho. He is also a relative from one of the http://anidb.net/ch95889 [Tsukiyama] branch families. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Kurei
character.description: Kurei was the president of the Apollo Group, a subsidiary of the http://anidb.net/ch95889 [Tsukiyama Group]. He owned Apollo TEC, Apollo Forestry, and the Luna Eclipse building. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Michibata Shinji
character.description: Michibata Shinji was a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and the deputy squad leader of the http://anidb.net/ch96198 [Itou Squad]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Hakubitei
character.description: The Sunlit Garden, also sometimes referred to as the Garden, is a facility owned by the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [Commission of Counter Ghoul]. It is responsible for providing "talented" children with a special education, though it is not publicly disclosed what this means. The organizations http://anidb.net/ch98950 [V] and the http://anidb.net/ch98951 [Washuu Clan] are also involved in the Garden`s management. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki
